neural_network module¶

Single hidden layer neural network implemented using back propagation.

neural_network.back_propagation_delta(y, y_tilde)[source]¶

Back propagation matrix delta which, in this case, is the Jacobian of the cross-entropy loss function with respect to Z, the output of the hidden layer, where the output function is the softmax operator.

neural_network.back_propagation_s(delta, w, beta, sigma_prime)[source]¶

Back propagation matrix s which, in this case, is the Jacobian of the output of the hidden layer with respect to the input X.

neural_network.calibrate_neural_network(K, M, p, sigma, sigma_prime, y, x, gradient_descent_method, **kwargs)[source]¶

Calibrates a neural network with one hidden layer for classification.

Parameters:
  • K (int) – Number of classes for classification
  • M (int) – Number of neurons in the hidden layer
  • p (int) – Number of features in x
  • (function (sigma_prime) – array-like to array-like): Activation function (e.g. sigmoid function).
  • (function – array-like to array-like): Derivative of sigma.
  • y (1d NumPy array) – Y observations in the training set
  • x (2d NumPy array) – X observations in the training set
  • gradient_descent_method (string) – Selects the gradient descent method. The available methods are: “Gradient Descent” and “Mini-batch Gradient Descent”.
  • **kwargs – arguments passed to the optimiser
Returns:

returns the approximated value of x such that f(x) = 0 given the algorithm interruption conditions.
Return type:

array-like
neural_network.cross_entropy(y, y_tilde)[source]¶

Computes the cross-entropy loss function for a given model.

Parameters:
  • y (1d or 2d Numpy array) – Observed outcomes.
  • y_tilde (1d or 2d Numpy array) – Computed outcomes.
Returns:

Returns the cross-entropy loss.
Return type:

float or 1d Numpy array
neural_network.neural_network(x, g, sigma, alpha_0, alpha, beta_0, beta)[source]¶

Evaluates the neural network with one hidden layer.

Parameters:
  • x (1d or 2d Numpy array) – Input vector x.
  • (function (sigma) – array-like to array-like): Output function (e.g. softmax function).
  • (function – array-like to array-like): Activation function (e.g. sigmoid function).
  • alpha_0 (NumPy array) – Bias parameter vector from the input layer to the hidden layer.
  • alpha (NumPy 2d array) – Weights parameter matrix from the input layer to the hidden layer.
  • beta_0 (NumPy array) – Bias parameter vector from the hidden layer to the output layer.
  • beta (NumPy 2d array) – Weights parameter matrix from the hidden layer to the output layer.
Returns:

Returns the neural network output vector.
Return type:

1d or 2d Numpy array
neural_network.neural_network_gradient(x, y, sigma, sigma_prime, alpha_0, alpha, beta_0, beta)[source]¶

Evaluates the gradient of the loss function of the single-layer neural network when the loss function is the cross-entropy and the output function is the softmax operator.

Parameters:
  • x (1d Numpy array) – Observed input matrix x.
  • x – Observed outcome vector y.
  • (function (sigma_prime) – array-like to array-like): Activation function (e.g. sigmoid function).
  • (function – array-like to array-like): Derivative of sigma.
  • alpha_0 (NumPy array) – Bias parameter vector from the input layer to the hidden layer.
  • alpha (NumPy 2d array) – Weights parameter matrix from the input layer to the hidden layer.
  • beta_0 (NumPy array) – Bias parameter vector from the hidden layer to the output layer.
  • beta (NumPy 2d array) – Weights parameter matrix from the hidden layer to the output layer.
Returns:

Returns the Jacobian of the neural network output vector.
Return type:

2d Numpy array
neural_network.theta_map(theta, p, M, K)[source]¶

Auxiliary function used in the `calibrate_neural_network function. It splits the 1d parameter array into the bias vectors and weight matrices.
